meanings.sent1: The lunk tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a lunk; pay attention in class.
meanings.sent3: The lunk tried to juggle but ended up dropping everything.
meanings.sent4: His brain felt like a lunk, slow to process any information.
meanings.sent5: The lunk's actions were as awkward as a penguin on a skateboard.

meanings.definition: To hit someone or something heavily.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally lunked his elbow on the table.
meanings.sent2: The boxer lunked his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: She lunked the door shut in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The storm lunked the trees with strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The hammer lunked down on the nail, driving it into the wood.

meanings.sent1: The lunk of the hammer echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The distant lunk of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The old car made a lunk as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent4: The heavy book hitting the floor made a loud lunk.
meanings.sent5: The lunk of the falling rock reverberated in the canyon.
